summary: Pour la version française de cette page, voir GAO-23-106250 . The U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID) provided $2 billion to support reconstruction and development in Haiti during FYs 2010-2020. It completed half of the infrastructure projects we reviewed—such as constructing a power plant—but most projects were delayed, cost more than planned, or had to be scaled back. USAID developed unrealistic estimates of costs and...
title: Haiti: USAID and State Should Improve Management and Assessment of Reconstruction Activities
